item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Jonathan Evison
item.description: "First, I'm going to give you all the Copperfield crap, and I'm not going to apologize for any of it, not one paragraph, so if you're not interested in how I came to see the future, or how I came to understand that the biggest truth in my life was a lie, or, for that matter, how I parlayed my distaste for hot dogs into an '84 RX-7 and a new self-concept, do us both a favor, and just stop now." -- Jonathan Evison

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Jonathan Evison
item.description: "We are born haunted, he said, his voice weak, but still clear. Haunted by our fathers and mothers and daughters, and by people we don't remember. We are haunted by otherness, by the path not taken, by the life unlived. We are haunted by the changing winds and the ebbing tides of history. And even as our own flame burns brightest, we are haunted by the embers of the first dying fire. But mostly, said Lord Jim, we are haunted by ourselves." -- Jonathan Evison

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Jonathan Evison
item.description: "Can we really be whoever we want to be, now that we’ve collected all that we are?" -- Jonathan Evison

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Jonathan Evison
item.description: "A man’s destiny is not in the eyes of others. It’s in his own. And that, my young friend, is as good as any bank note." -- Jonathan Evison

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Jonathan Evison
item.description: "He threw himself headlong at a job as if were he to stop the job would throw itself headlong back at him." -- Jonathan Evison

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Jonathan Evison
item.description: "He prayed for clear skies and discovery, for danger and heartache and laughter, for a life beyond fear, a life that got bigger, really got bigger, as it receded." -- Jonathan Evison

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Jonathan Evison
item.description: "People really do change. Don't let anyone tell you differently. That the future does not conform to the past is not the exception, but the rule." -- Jonathan Evison
